description: This file implements the functions related to a Trace Route Sink Object, including buffer management, accepting connections, receiving data, closing, and aborting operations. It appears to be part of a module for handling traceroute operations in a broadband management system, utilizing socket communication.

methods.name: PVOID BbhmDiagitSinkGetRecvBuffer(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,PANSC_HANDLE phRecvHandle,PULONG pulSize)
methods.description: Retrieves a buffer for receiving data from the socket, providing buffer size and pointer.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS BbhmDiagitSinkAccept(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,ANSC_HANDLE hNewSocket)
methods.description: Handles acceptance of a new socket connection, creating a new sink object and removing the old one.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS BbhmDiagitSinkRecv(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,ANSC_HANDLE hRecvHandle,PVOID buffer,ULONG ulSize)
methods.description: Receives data from the socket and passes it to the traceroute object for processing.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS BbhmDiagitSinkClose(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,BOOL bByPeer)
methods.description: Closes the sink object, resetting its state.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS BbhmDiagitSinkAbort(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Handles critical network failure by aborting the sink object.
